title: Letterhead, "P. Lorillard Company / Cigarettes-Tobacco,  Hong Kong and New York", early–mid-20th century
title_raw: P. Lorillard Company / Cigarettes-Tobacco,  Hong Kong and New York
medium: Letterpress: gold, black ink on white wove paper
markings: Watermark: Circle encircling man standing next to a tall tobacco plant; the words "FINEST TOBACCOS" are visible at the top of the image.
inscribed:
Imprinted, upper center:  P. Lorillard Company/ INCORPORATED(in very small typeface size)/CIGARETTES-TOBACCO/ P.O. Box  5254, Kowloon Post Office, Hong Kong, B.C.C.
Imprinted in small type size (below Logo and  Company name) at upper left: NEW YORK OFFICE / 200 EAST 42nd STREET / NEW YORK, NEW YORK 10017 / 
CABLE ADDRESS,  SCRAMBLE, NEW YORK. Top right corner: CABLE ADDRESS: SCRAMBLE, HONG KONG
description: Logo vignette of two Indians with tobacco leaf headress seated amidst bales of tobacco in black and gold at upper left.  Text above logo states: AMERICA'S FIRST TOBACCO COMPANY (in gold); below logo image, "ESTABLSHED 1760 (in black).  Company name and Hong Kong address imprinted across top of sheet; New York Office address at upper left (below logo). T

tombstone.epitaph: Letterhead, "P. Lorillard Company / Cigarettes-Tobacco,  Hong Kong and New York", early–mid-20th century. Letterpress: gold, black ink on white wove paper. Gift of Thomas F. O'Malley. 1998-64-9.
